wikipedia_page.main: John Shaw Thomson was  a rugby union international who represented Scotland in the first international rugby match in 1871.

response: The University of St Andrews Athletic Union is the student representative body for sport. Established in 1901, it is affiliated to BUCS and encompasses around sixty sport clubs, who compete at both a recreational and high-performance level. A notable club is the University of St Andrews Rugby Football Club, which played a pivotal role in shaping the sport and has produced Scottish international players such as J. S. Thomson and Alfred Clunies-Ross.

link_mentions.page: List of Scotland national rugby union players
